title: How Paul Pogba spent international break recovering ahead of Liverpool clash
text:

Paul Pogba will not feature for Manchester United at Liverpool in the Premier League this weekend, but it isn't through a lack of trying.

While many of his Utd colleagues jetted off for international duty last week, the former Juventus man headed to Dubai for some warm weather training in a bid to rid himself of an injury that has troubled him for most of the season.

The Frenchman aggravated an ankle problem as Utd drew 1-1 at home to Arsenal in the Premier League last month, missing the defeat at Newcastle and the Europa League draw against Dutch club AZ Alkmaar .

The niggle also kept the World Cup winner out of the latest France squad, being forced to watch on as his country edged closer to qualification for Euro 2020 .

Instead, the former Juventus man was putting in the hard graft in the UAE to give him a chance of being fit to feature for Utd against their fierce rivals this weekend.

(Image: paulpogba/Instagram)

Though he ultimately came up short in his bid to return to full fitness, Pogba showed great determination to the Utd cause by working hard over the break to get back to full fitness.

The French international offered fans a glimpse into the effort he was putting in, first uploading a clip to Instagram where Pogba could be seen using an exercise bike on a Dubai rooftop.

There was some concern just days later, though, when the 26-year-old posted a second workout clip from the UAE where his troublesome ankle could be seen heavily strapped.

However, the ex-Juve man appeared to downplay those fears as he captioned the clip: "Almost there. Show off or motivation. You choose? Same result at the end anyway."

That suggested the World Cup winner was closing in on a return to action thanks to his trip to Dubai, although it seems this weekend's match at Anfield has come too soon.

(Image: Getty Images)

Though he has not been at his best so far this term, Utd will still miss Pogba against Liverpool with the 26-year-old undoubtedly one of the league's best players when on top form.

Despite being the most successful club in English league history, Utd start the weekend close to the relegation zone than the top four having won just twice this season.
description: The midfielder will miss Sunday's game at Anfield, but has been working hard to try to get over a recent ankle injury
